intro: Psychotria boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces berries that are typically red or orange when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. Psychotria boliviana is often found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
